messages.title: Rushcliffe Parliamentary Election Thursday May 7 2015
messages.content: Labour Party Called Today. We Are Sorry That We Missed You.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: More affordable housing & a better deal for tenants in the private rented sector

housing.content: Campaigning for a vibrant, welcoming town for all with a variety of retail shops. More affordable housing & a better deal for tenants in the private rented sector

leaflet.personalStatement: David Mellen is the Labour Parliamentary Candidate for Rushcliffe. He has 20 years of experience of Primary Education including being a Deputy Head in Keyworth and Headteacher in Nottingham. He is also a City Councillor in Nottingham as well as working part-time for a church in West Bridgford as a Children’s worker. David is already known to thousands of residents of Rushcliffe on their doorsteps and at community events. He is keen to hear about your priorities and concerns for your area.

politicalExperience.achievements: Known to thousands of residents of Rushcliffe on their doorsteps and at community events
20 years of experience of Primary Education
20 years of experience of Primary Education
Actively involved in the local community

contactInformation.address: 70 Melton Road, West Bridgford, Nottingham NG2 7NF

images.caption: David Mellen - Labour - Putting Rushcliffe First

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet also mentions Rushcliffe Labour Party and provides contact details for Liz Plant and Alistair MacInnes related to the Rushcliffe Borough Council Election for Trent Bridge Ward.
